p: A Type IIIb breach affects both strategies equally, requiring an entire secondary eradication at the site of the failure. It does not change the relative benefit of containment or eradication strategies, and switching from a well-specified eradication programme to a containment programme at the original infestation following this sort of breach will not improve the efficiency of management. The potential for such a breach of both containment and eradication programmes highlights the importance of effective surveillance strategies (Panetta & Cacho 2012).
